title: sample sba report
description: this is a sample of the types of analyses and automated reports i create for the sba

title: confederate monuments and the history of lynching in the american south
description: we find that the number of lynching victims in a county is a positive and significant predictor of the number of Confederate memorializations in that county. this finding provides historically and geographically situated evidence consistent with the position that Confederate memorializations reflect a racist history, one marred by intentions to terrorize and intimidate Black Americans in response to Black progress.

title: inequities in access to COVID-19 clinical trials
description: i developed a new method to assess geospatial inequities in the US through drivetimes analyses and bootstrapping. we applied it to COVID-19 clinical trials

title: unsupervised learning for equity assessment
description: [my MA thesis] developing a new clustering method to that can handle health benefit data to uncover disparities faced by people living with hiv

title: virginia reading equity
description: [in progress]: developing an interactive database emphasizing racial inequities in reading education

title: voices for equity uva
description: analyzing 50 years of calls to action for racial equity at the University of Virginia [illustration by JD Whitworth]

title: selected visualizations
description: some collected static visualizations done for client work

title: systemic disparities in prior authorization for PrEP
description: insurance companies' prior authorization requirements for PrEP disproportionately burden people living with HIV in the US South

title: cville shelter in place
description: investigating how the eases and burdens of sheltering in place are distributed across the Charlottesville region

title: cville region frontline workers
description: highlighting racial disparities in benefits & risks faced by Charlottesville frontline workers during the covid crisis.

title: determined to be free
description: with journalist Jordy Yager, we analyze stop and frisk data to supplement stories of racial profiling and discriminatory incarceration contexualized within cville's  racialized zoning practices

title: cville stop and frisk
description: a mock-up design of a public data portal for policing data in cville

title: cville affordable housing
description: a quantitative and narrative investigation of housing discrimination in cville and its historical roots

title: court watch data project
description: exploring bond setting, sentencing, & prosecutorial discretion practices in colorado courtrooms using data from 1600+ observed trials in Fall 2019

title: whom do we confine?
description: a visual tool for exploring the history and realities of mass incarceration in america

title: single issuer districts
description: a data essay on how the ACA's reliance on competition between providers may be hurting patient care

title: colorado jail data capacity bill
description: investigating the quality & availability of public jail data in colorado fueled a new law setting standardized data reporting practices for the state

title: covid-19 incarceration reform
